relevant_findings.initial: Dusky appearance and shivering noted. After treatment, initial vital signs showed mild hyperthermia with a temperature of 101.2°F, heart rate of 126 bpm, blood pressure of 148/92 mmHg, respiratory rate of 20 breaths/min, and oxygen saturation of 88% on 4L.
relevant_findings.subsequent: On admission: Alert, no acute distress; BP: 141/98 mmHg, P: 95 bpm, R: 22 breaths/min, O2: 100% on 2L.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient presented with shivering and changes in vital signs indicating potential deterioration; however, improved to alert status and normal oxygen saturation with treatment.

relevant_findings.initial: Non-verbal and close to baseline with altered responses.
relevant_findings.subsequent: Calm, able to follow simple commands, denies current pain.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with notable neurological deficits and shivering; subsequent examination revealed improvement in responsiveness and demeanor.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cloudy urine with sediment, few bacteria, positive nitrites noted in UA.
